title: Thank You, Everyone

author: larry
post: The 3 D characteristic of the Shroud includes the entire front and back of the body image. This first allows us to recreate the exact manner of how the body was laying at the time the image was formed. The Vatican exhibit contains such a “statue” in repose and the knees and head are tilted up. Forensics tell us that any such body is in rigor mortis. We also know that rigor mortis relaxes after a max of 48 hours. Thus, the 3 D characteristic of the Shroud image establishes that the image was formed in the first 48 hours after death. In other words, we are given a timeline for image formation by the 3 D characteristic. Also interesting to note that if the person forming the image died at about 3 PM on Friday it was about 40 hours until dawn on Sunday – well within the 48 hour limit. Could this be the purpose of the 3 D?? Very interesting!!.
title: The Shroud of Turin Exhibit & Museum in Alamogordo
